result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew L. Lloyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:11 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Andrew L. Lloyd in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the Court, the Court strikes the domestic abuse repeater on Count #4

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated on Counts #2 & #4; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #1 & #3
DA Happ submits victim impact statement & restitution request form

On Counts #2 & #4, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges(on Count #2); to commence forthwith 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No contact with Tabitha Lloyd unless both she and Agent agree
--Complete a Certified Batterers' Intervention Program
--No acts/threats of violence
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges
--To pay domestic abuse surcharge on each
--To pay DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay restitution of $240 payable to Tabitha Lloyd

Days credit for time already served: 35 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 3:42 pm
NOH for DEF. for 9/15/15 Arraignment//DEF. in Custody
For DEF. (1) Notice of Assignment Judge (2)Application & Order for Specific Judge//DEF. in custody

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:00am [mo]
Defendant Andrew L. Lloyd in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Mr.Lloyd waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

ADA Hall submits Information 
Atty. Svehlek requests an Arraignment to be scheduled for a later date
recess: 9:04am

NEXT:  Arraignment: 8/24/15 at 8:30am

Case called at 1:20pm [mo]
[Judge Koschnick presiding for Branch II Intake]

Defendant Andrew L. Lloyd appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Dahnert indicates that Mr. Lloyd is eligible for PD representation

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Defense does NOT waive time limits

The Court requires a $5,000 CASH bond, with conditions:
--No Contact with Tabitha Lloyd
--No presence at Ms. Lloyd's residence which is currently 304 North Pleasant Ave, Jefferson, WI
--Mr. Lloyd may return to the 304 Pleasant Ave. address on one occasion in the presence of law enforcement to retrieve personal belongings
--no acts of violence or threats of violence

recess 1:27  pm. 


NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 8/17/2015 at 8:30am
